item.description:
This is the ninth session of our HAC group, in which we work through a readable guide to the bizarre logic and historical inaccuracy of the Hebrew Bible.

Please read the following sections from our series reference How to Read the Bible: A Guide to Scripture, Then and Now, by James L. Kugel.

  • Chapter 27. David the King, pages 474-492
  • Chapter 28. Solomon's Wisdom, pages 493-518
  • Chapter 29. North and South, pages 519-537

And read the following:

  • The Wikipedia entry on "Books of Samuel"
  • The Wikipedia entry on "David"
  • The Wikipedia entry on "Solomon"
  • The Wikipedia entry on "Rehoboam"
  • The Wikipedia entry on "Elijah"
  • The New World Encyclopedia entry on "Elijah"


If you are new to the group, in addition to the assigned reading for the next meeting, you can quickly get up to speed by reading:

1) The New York Times review article "Reading Is Believing, or Not" By David Plotz (available at
http://www.nytimes.co... )

2) The article "The Editorial Team Behind the Bible--Interview with Richard Elliott Friedman" (available at http://www.beliefnet....)

and, if you are more ambitious,

3) In " How to Read the Bible: A Guide to Scripture, Then and Now" by James L. Kugel, the following:
Preliminaries -- pages xi-xiv
The Rise of Modern Biblical Scholarship--pages 1-46

See you on 5/30.

For more information, see http://www.cthumanist...
